arts.ttl: Football League: Birmingham extend lead at top as Wrexham left chasing
arts.sum: Wycombe frustrated by draw; Charlton win to keep pace Walsall draw maintains lead; Port Vale beat Bradford Jay Stansfield’s late penalty was the difference as Birmingham extended their lead at the top of League One to 11 points with a 2-1 win against Bristol Rovers. Keshi Anderson gave Blues the lead after only three minutes and, although Gatlin O’Donkor equalised, Stansfield’s spot-kick made it back-to-back league wins. Continue reading...

arts.ttl: Sam Smith earns Wrexham a point against his former club Cambridge
arts.sum: George Dobson opened the scoring, with Liam Bennett and Josh Stokes on target for the U’s.

arts.ttl: Ryan Reynolds publicly called out as Wrexham flight details emerge
arts.sum: Wrexham reportedly chartered a private jet for a 37-minute flight last month, with air travel a regular occurrence under their Hollywood owners

arts.ttl: Ryan Reynolds and Wrexham on guard over finances and being 'caught with pants down'
arts.sum: Wrexham's documentary has been a major financial success for the club under their Hollywood ownership, but officials are wary of becoming too reliant on the hit TV show

arts.ttl: Ryan Reynolds' Wrexham wary of being 'caught with pants down' after financial admission
arts.sum: Wrexham have enjoyed a huge financial boost from the documentary charting the club's Hollywood ownership, but officials say they are wary of becoming too reliant on it continuing

arts.ttl: Ryan Reynolds told where Wrexham rank financially in Championship as £8m deal eyed up
arts.sum: Wrexham's latest financial results have been analysed by football finance expert Kieran Maguire, who has provided insight into the club's standing compared to other teams

arts.ttl: Where Ryan Reynolds' Wrexham 'rank financially in Championship' as £8m payday edges closer
arts.sum: Wrexham's stunning financial results would put them in a strong position to compete in the Championship if they gain promotion, according to a football finance expert

arts.ttl: Fast-rising Wrexham's record turnover helps repay all loans to owners Reynolds and McElhenney
arts.sum: The costs of promotion last season, including staff bonuses, contributed to an annual loss of more than 2.7 million pounds ($3.5 million). Record turnover reported on Monday of 26.7 million pounds ($34.5 million) last season was a 155% raise and helped the fast-improving club to repay all of its loans and interest totaling 15 million pounds ($19.36 million) to The R.R McReynolds Company.

arts.ttl: Wrexham announce record revenue of £26.7m after boost in US popularity
arts.sum: More than half its turnover outside Europe in 2023-24 Filming continuing for fourth TV series about the club Wrexham’s increasing popularity in the United States helped the club secure record revenue of £26.7m in their latest accounts, up 155% on the previous year. Wrexham, who are co-owned by Ryan Reynolds and Rob McElhenney, said they generated more than half (52.1%) of that record turnover from outside Europe – primarily North America – for the year ending 30 June 2024. That compared with 24.6% of turnover being generated outside Europe in the previous year’s figures. The club said the spectacular rise highlighted the effect of the “Welcome to Wrexham” documentary series, with the fourth instalment being filmed this season. Continue reading...

arts.ttl: Five insights from Wrexham's record financial results
arts.sum: BBC Sport Wales looks at the main talking points as League One promotion hopefuls Wrexham report record financial results.
